Time Kiosk Guide for Employers and Employees
What the Time Kiosk Offers
A simple, user-friendly interface for employees to clock in/out, track breaks, and manage shifts.
Easy-to-setup process for employer administrators with the ability to configure multiple kiosks.
Optional Photo Security for increased accountability and compliance.
Accessibility via any modern browser on a tablet or computer, making it highly flexible.
Real-time time entries that feed directly into employee timesheets, simplifying payroll processes.
Key Features of the Time Kiosk
Web-based Access: No app installation needed—simply access through a browser.
PIN-based Login: Employees receive unique 6-digit PINs to log in into the kiosk and track their time.
Facial Recognition: Employees can set up the face data once and can use facial recognition for login.
Photo Security: Optional feature to capture a photo during clock-in/out for additional security.
Multi-Kiosk Setup: Administrators can set up and manage multiple kiosks across different locations.
Shift and Job Selection: Employees can select their shifts and jobs when clocking in, ensuring accurate tracking.
For Employer Administrators: Setting up the Time Kiosk

To set up a new kiosk for time tracking, go to Time Tracking Settings -> Time Clocks and under the Kiosk section click on the link “Add Kiosk”. On click of this, a row will appear where you need to enter following inputs
Kiosk Name- Enter the desired kiosk name, example the Location’s Name.
Login Method Login method is the mechanism by which the employees will be able to login into the kiosk. It has two options-
PIN- By selecting this, the employees will be able to login only by PIN given to them by the UZIO system.

Face Unlock or PIN- By selecting this, the employees will be able to login PIN given to them by UZIO system or by facial recognition. Make sure the device is camera enabled and the permission for using the camera is granted.

Photo Security- Enable this feature for added verification during clock-in/out. This setting ensures that a photo is captured and stored with each time entry, giving you added peace of mind regarding the authenticity of time logs.

Activation Code- To activate the kiosk on a device, take the device and open a browser on the selected device (ideally a tablet) and navigate to kiosk.uzio.com. A unique Activation Code will be displayed on the browser. Enter this code in the Activation Code field during kiosk setup.

Consent- If you choose Face Unlock or PIN as your login method—or if you enable Photo Security—you must first review and accept UZIO’s Biometric Policy and Terms of Use. This consent confirms you understand how your data is used and allows these security features to function.
Once the first kiosk is activated, employees added to the time tracking will get their login PIN in their registered email id.

Multi-Kiosk Configuration
If your workplace has multiple locations or departments, you can configure as many kiosks as needed. Employees can log in to any kiosk with their PIN, regardless of the kiosk's physical location.

Employee Enrollment & PIN Generation
After kiosk setup, all employees added to the time tracking module will automatically be assigned to the kiosk. A unique 6-digit Login PIN will be generated for each employee, which will be emailed and sent via SMS to the provided work contact information.
Employee Login on Kiosk
Employees can clock in by PIN or Facial recognition. To use the facial login, the employee must first set it up. Employee can set the facedata by two ways

Setting up Face Data on the Kiosk-
Log in with PIN,  Go to Settings → Set Up Face Scan, Review and accept consent, Follow on-screen prompts to capture face, Receive confirmation that enrollment is saved.

Setting up Face Data on the Mobile App
Open the app → Menu → Kiosk Login,  Select Set Up Face Scan, Review and accept consent, Capture face; enrollment is saved for kiosk use.
Manage face data-  Employees can delete or re-enroll their face data at any time from the same Settings path on both the kiosk and the mobile app.

Login on Kiosk- Once the face data is set up, the kiosk allows users to login by face or PIN. To login with PIN first locate your name on the kiosk home screen and then enter the PIN or use the option “Use Face Unlock” to scan your facial identification.
For Employees: Using the Time Kiosk
1. Clocking In/Out
Login using your PIN or Facial Recognition.

Employees can track time against their assigned shifts and assigned jobs on the kiosk. On the home page, if the previously selected shift and job looks good to the employee, they can directly click on the “Clock IN” button.

Else, from the home page, employees can select the “Shift” first.Once an employee selects the shift the next screen appears to select the “Job”. After selecting the job the employee gets clock into the select shift and job.

Shift selection is auto-preselected to speed up clock-ins. If the current time falls within a scheduled shift, that shift is preselected. If no shift is active but another is scheduled later the same day, the nearest upcoming shift is preselected. If the employee has no shift assigned for that date, the shift selector droplist is hidden.

The job selection is dependent on the Shift. If the selected shift has a designated job then after selecting the shift, the job selection screen does not appear and employee directly clock in to the designated job of the shift.If the shift does not have a designated job then employee can choose the job as per the assigned jobs.

Employees can choose Unscheduled shifts if they’re working outside scheduled hours. Unless the employer enforces restrictions (e.g. prevent early clock-ins), employees may select any shift scheduled for that day.
After clock-in, the user will be auto logged out in 5 seconds.
2. Taking Breaks
The kiosk allows you to log your breaks, ensuring that your working hours and break times are accurately recorded:
Starting a break
Login using your PIN or Facial Recognition.
Click Start Break In.
If you have multiple break types (e.g., meal break, rest break), the system will ask you to choose the appropriate one else system will start the assigned break instantly.
After break-in, the user will be auto logged out in 5 seconds.
Ending a Break
Login using your PIN or Facial Recognition.
Click End Break and Clock IN to end the break and the working hours will be resumed.
Click Clock Out to end the break as well as clock out from the working hours.
After break-in, the user will be auto logged out in 5 seconds.
Managing Employee Access and Security
Forgotten PIN: Employees who forget their PIN can reset it through multiple options:
Click on Forgot PIN on the kiosk to receive an email/SMS with the PIN.
Use the employee portal or mobile app to reset their PIN
Request a manager to reset their PIN on their behalf, which will trigger a notification to their registered email and phone number.

Resetting PINs for Employees
Administrators or managers can reset employee PINs through the employer portal by navigating to the employee’s Login Accounts section or using the Reset Kiosk PIN quick link, accessible from the employee portal’s homepage by impersonating the employee’s account. This feature is especially useful when an employee encounters PIN-related issues or requires immediate access to the kiosk
Photo Security: Enhancing Accountability

Photo security provides an added layer of verification for employee clock-ins and clock-outs by capturing a photo during these actions. This is especially useful in environments where it's important to ensure that the person clocking in or out is the actual employee assigned to that shift. The photos will be added to the time entries on employee timesheets for verification.

Enable Photo Security
This feature can be turned on during the kiosk setup or later. Once enabled, employees will be required to allow camera access for the kiosk to function correctly.
Browser Camera Permissions
Ensure that the browser on the device where the kiosk is installed has access to the device’s camera. A permission prompt will appear when the kiosk is first accessed.
If the camera is denied permission, administrators will need to adjust the settings in the browser to grant access.
Legal Compliance

Employee Consent: It's essential to obtain explicit written consent from employees before activating photo security. Make sure employees are aware of how their photos will be used, stored, and for how long.

Compliance with State Laws: States like Illinois, Maryland, and Oregon have specific restrictions on biometric data and facial recognition. Regularly review privacy and biometric laws in your area to ensure compliance.
3. Troubleshooting PIN Issues
Forgotten PIN: Tap the Forgot PIN button on the kiosk login screen. You'll receive your PIN via your registered  email and SMS Text ((if phone number is provided).

Reset PIN: You can reset your PIN through the employee portal by using the Reset Kiosk PIN link available under the Quick Links section. If you are using the mobile app, you can find the same option under the Biometric Login menu. Alternatively, you can ask your manager to reset the PIN for you.
Device Requirements & Recommendations
To ensure optimal performance, follow these guidelines for selecting and setting up a Time Kiosk device:

Supported Devices: Tablets and computers with internet access are supported. While mobile phones are not recommended due to screen resolution limitations, tablets with a screen size of 8 to 12 inches better user experience.
Browser Compatibility: The kiosk supports the latest four versions of the following browsers:
Chrome (Desktop, iOS, Android)
Safari (Desktop, iOS)
Firefox
Edge
If using an Android tablet, make sure you are not running the kiosk in the desktop mode.
Operating System (OS): Ensure that your device's OS is updated to support the recommended browsers.

Device Placement: It is recommended that each device be dedicated solely to the kiosk. Although multiple kiosks can be set up on the same device through different browser tabs, assigning one kiosk per device minimizes confusion and ensures smooth operations.
Workplace Setup: Best Practices for Kiosk Placement
For a seamless time tracking experience, follow these best practices when placing the kiosk in your workplace:
Location: Place the kiosk in a convenient, easily accessible area, such as a break room or near an entrance, ensuring that all employees can clock in and out quickly.
Security: Ensure that the kiosk device is secured in a tamper-proof location. Consider mounting the tablet to a stand and using locks for additional security.
Orientation: If the camera on your tablet is placed along the shorter edge, use your tablet in portrait orientation. If the camera is placed along the longer edge, use it in landscape orientation.
Privacy: If the Photo Security feature is enabled, respect employee privacy by avoiding placement in exposed or public areas where others may see the clock-in process.
Clear Instructions: Provide clear, concise instructions next to the kiosk so that employees who are unfamiliar with the process can easily follow along.
Advanced Troubleshooting
PIN Not Received: Ensure the employee’s registered email (work email) and phone number available on employee’s record are correct in the system. Resend/Reset the PIN if necessary.
Photo Security Not Functioning:
Check if the camera permissions are enabled for the browser.
Test the camera separately to ensure it is functional.
Re-enable Photo Security in the kiosk settings and refresh the page.
Kiosk Unresponsive:
Refresh the browser page.
Restart the device.
Check for internet connectivity issues.

Reappearing Activation Code:
This occurs when a previously activated kiosk has been deleted. Set up a new kiosk in Time Tracking Settings and activate it with the newly generated code.
Using Time Tracking in Offline Mode
Enable Time Tracking in Offline Mode
Uzio supports using limited actions of employee time tracking even if the internet connection is not available. To enable this feature follow the steps
Login as employer admin
Open Time Tracking Settings from the left navigation
Go to Time Clocks and enable the setting  - Enable employees to track time without an internet connection?
What actions are allowed in offline mode
Offline time tracking features are only available for employees. Any employer level action cannot be performed in the offline mode like- Time Hours approval, syncing hours to payroll etc.
The employees can perform following actions in the offline mode
Clock In
Break In
Break Out
Clock Out

Rest other actions are disabled in the offline mode. The employee remains on the time tracking page of the mobile app. Employees cannot go to other pages in the offline mode. The app restricts the ability to move the employee on any other pages.
How system works in offline mode
When the employee is working offline, the app shows a tag of “Offline”.
Whenever an employee performs an action in the offline mode, the system records the action in the local memory of the mobile device.
All the actions performed on the mobile device in offline mode, the system maintains the sequence as well.

As soon as the internet connection is restored, the system automatically starts the syncing process which usually takes 10-15 seconds. When the syncing process is in progress, the system shows a spinning wheel on the top right corner of the app that shows the progress of the syncing process.
The syncing process includes sending the recorded actions in the offline mode to the server.
Conflict Handling

Conflict is a situation when one time entry recorded in the  offline mode is overlapping by any other time entry recorded in the online mode. Example- Employee clocked in, in the OFFLINE mode from mobile app and before internet connectivity restoration, employee also clocked in, in the ONLINE mode from web. Later on connectivity was restored on the mobile, so the system tried to sync the offline entry but found that it was overlapping with the online time entry.

When the conflicting situation occurs, the system shows the Conflict on the offline time entry on the mobile device. The system fails to sync the entry on the server and shows a conflict on the mobile app.
The employee has to resolve the conflict by editing the time entries on the app.
Employees have two options
Edit

Resolution of conflict is a manual process in which employees need to fix the entries intelligently so that overlapping is resolved. The employee needs to edit the time entry to resolve the overlapping situation. Once the overlapping situation is resolved, the system automatically syncs the time entries from mobile device to server.
Discard
Employees can discard the conflicting entry. By doing so, the conflicting offline time entry will be discarded and removed from the timesheet page on the mobile device.
